intro: Causonis wentsiana, commonly known as the Wentsian sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cariophyllaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and Angola. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in dry environments. Its flowers are typically pink or red, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the cooler months. Causonis wentsiana is well adapted to sandy soils and can thrive in harsh, low-nutrient conditions.
